course.title: Introduction to Sociology
course.description: Introduces students to the main objects and goals of Sociology-both for sociology concentrators and curious non-concentrators. Explores the theories of classical authors in the history of sociology (such as Marx, Durkheim, Weber, and beyond). Examines major topics in sociological research (including but not limited to social problems, deviance, inequality, social change, culture, education, social interaction).
course.notes: May be counted for introductory concentration requirement, if letter-graded.
